li.Students are responsible for meeting any: Students are responsible for meeting any prerequisites for the courses in the minor or for obtaining course instructor permission if prerequisites are not met.

courseSection0.text:
Admission Requirements
None
Minor Requirements
None
Prerequisite Courses
Students are responsible for meeting any prerequisites for the courses in the minor or for obtaining course instructor permission if prerequisites are not met.

p.A list of approved restricted elective c: A list of approved restricted elective courses is found in the myKnight audit.
p.Select 4 additional Pre-Law Humanities m: Select 4 additional Pre-Law Humanities minor courses from the list below. Students may select from the 2 courses not chosen above.

li.ENC 4312 - Theory & Practice Persuasive: ENC 4312 - Theory & Practice Persuasive Writing Credit Hours: 3
li.LIN 4801 - Language and Meaning Credit H: LIN 4801 - Language and Meaning Credit Hours: 3
li.LIT 3437 - International Environmental J: LIT 3437 - International Environmental Justice Literature Credit Hours: 3
li.AMH 3560 - Women, Law, and Society in Am: AMH 3560 - Women, Law, and Society in American History Credit Hours: 3
li.EUH 4504 - English Legal History I Credi: EUH 4504 - English Legal History I Credit Hours: 3
li.WOH 4272 - Age of Atlantic Revolutions 1: WOH 4272 - Age of Atlantic Revolutions 1763-1826 Credit Hours: 3
li.WOH 4273 - Age of Atlantic Revolutions 1: WOH 4273 - Age of Atlantic Revolutions 1848-1920 Credit Hours: 3
li.WOH 4430 - Law and Disorder: Piracy and: WOH 4430 - Law and Disorder: Piracy and Maritime Law in the Atlantic World Credit Hours: 3
li.PHI 3131 - Formal Logic II Credit Hours:: PHI 3131 - Formal Logic II Credit Hours: 3
li.PHM 3401 - Philosophy of Law Credit Hour: PHM 3401 - Philosophy of Law Credit Hours: 3
li.REL 4178 - Religion and Law Credit Hours: REL 4178 - Religion and Law Credit Hours: 3
li.ENC 3314 - Writing and Rhetoric Foundati: ENC 3314 - Writing and Rhetoric Foundations Credit Hours: 3
li.You may take a maximum of 6 hours from a: You may take a maximum of 6 hours from a single department.
li.A grade of \"C\" (2.0) or better is requ: A grade of "C" (2.0) or better is required in each course used to satisfy the minor.
li.At least 12 hours used in the minor must: At least 12 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the College of Arts and Humanities.
li.No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit): No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
li.Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study: Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor.

courseSection0.text:
Restricted Electives (12 Credit Hours)

A list of approved restricted elective courses is found in the myKnight audit.
Select 4 additional Pre-Law Humanities minor courses from the list below. Students may select from the 2 courses not chosen above.

courseSection1.text:
English

ENC 4312 - Theory & Practice Persuasive Writing Credit Hours: 3
LIN 4801 - Language and Meaning Credit Hours: 3
LIT 3437 - International Environmental Justice Literature Credit Hours: 3

History

AMH 3560 - Women, Law, and Society in American History Credit Hours: 3
EUH 4504 - English Legal History I Credit Hours: 3
WOH 4272 - Age of Atlantic Revolutions 1763-1826 Credit Hours: 3
WOH 4273 - Age of Atlantic Revolutions 1848-1920 Credit Hours: 3
WOH 4430 - Law and Disorder: Piracy and Maritime Law in the Atlantic World Credit Hours: 3

Philosophy

PHI 2108 - Critical Thinking Credit Hours: 3
PHI 3131 - Formal Logic II Credit Hours: 3
PHI 3670 - Ethical Theory Credit Hours: 3
PHM 3401 - Philosophy of Law Credit Hours: 3
REL 4178 - Religion and Law Credit Hours: 3

Writing and Rhetoric

ENC 3250 - Professional Writing Credit Hours: 3
ENC 3314 - Writing and Rhetoric Foundations Credit Hours: 3
ENC 3315 - Argumentative Writing Credit Hours: 3
ENC 3330 - Rhetorical Traditions Credit Hours: 3
ENC 3373 - Cultural Rhetorics Credit Hours: 3

Foreign Language Requirements

None

courseSection3.text:
Other Requirements

You may take a maximum of 6 hours from a single department.
A grade of "C" (2.0) or better is required in each course used to satisfy the minor.
At least 12 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the College of Arts and Humanities.
No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor.
